name: delaminate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a material delaminates, or if something delaminates it, it breaks into thin layers: The number plates delaminate and moisture seeps in. An extra force was applied and this delaminated the tyre.
More examplesFewer examplesDon't leave surfboards out in the sun as they can easily overheat and delaminate. A technical problem caused the car bodywork to delaminate like wet cardboard.The tyre starts delaminating and becomes dangerous.The tube did not collapse, but a section delaminated and flaked off. The plane's plywood wings delaminated in the humidity.
